pyDKB.common package¶

Common modules.

Submodules¶

pyDKB.common.Type module¶

Abstract class for type definitions.

class pyDKB.common.Type.Type(*args)[source]¶

Bases: object

Abstract class for type definitions. Usage:

myType = Type(“Orange”, “Apple”)

myType.add(“Plum”)

t = myType.Orange

if t == myType.Orange:
# Oranges stuff
elif t == myType.member(“Apple”):
# Apples stuff

…

if not myType.hasMember(t):
print “Wrong type!”
add(name)[source]¶

Add new Type member.

hasMember(val)[source]¶

Check if the member exists (by value).

member(name)[source]¶

Check if the member exists (by name).

Return member value or False.

memberName(val)[source]¶

Return string name of the member.

pyDKB.common.custom_readline module¶

pyDKB.common.custom_readline.custom_readline(f, newline)[source]¶

Custom readline() function.

Custom_readline() separates content from a text file ‘f’ by delimiter ‘newline’ to distinct messages. The last line can be incomplete, if the input data flow is interrupted in the middle of data writing.

Keyword arguments: f – file/stream to read newline – custom delimiter

pyDKB.common.exceptions module¶

Definition of common modules exceptions

exception pyDKB.common.exceptions.HDFSException[source]¶

Bases: exceptions.RuntimeError

Base Exception for HDFS module.

pyDKB.common.hdfs module¶

Utils to interact with HDFS.

pyDKB.common.hdfs.check_stderr(proc, timeout=None, max_lines=1)[source]¶

Wait till the end of the subprocess and send its STDERR to STDERR.

Output only MAX_LINES of the STDERR to the current STDERR; if MAX_LINES == None, output all the STDERR.

Return value is the subprocess` return code.

pyDKB.common.hdfs.getfile(fname)[source]¶

Download file from HDFS.

Return value: file name (without directory)

pyDKB.common.hdfs.listdir(dirname, mode='a')[source]¶

List files and/or subdirectories of HDFS directory.

Parameters:

dirname – directory to list mode – ‘a’: list all objects

‘f’: list files ‘d’: list subdirectories
pyDKB.common.hdfs.makedirs(dirname)[source]¶

Try to create directory (with parents).

pyDKB.common.hdfs.putfile(fname, dest)[source]¶

Upload file to HDFS.

pyDKB.common.json_utils module¶

Utils to work with JSON (dict) objects.

pyDKB.common.json_utils.nestedKeys(key)[source]¶

Transform STRING with nested keys into LIST.

Parameters:
STRING key – dot-separated list of nested keys.
If a key contains dot itself, the key must be put between quotation marks.
pyDKB.common.json_utils.valueByKey(json_data, key)[source]¶

Return value by a chain (list) of nested keys.

Parameters:
DICT json_data – to search in STRING key – dot-separated list of nested keys
